answers.answer: Do NOT pump, your baby needs that colostrum! Wear breast pads for the leaking and yes it is normal. Nipple stimulation can cause labor to start but you are way to early if you are thinking about self inducing. Hope this helps

Oh no im not thinking bout inducing my self by any means !!! I just seen that like at 38-40 weeks people have squeezed that stuff out and froze it for the baby .. thats why i posted this cuz i do not want early labor .. well at least this early lol

If your boobs hurt you can squeeze a bit out but don't pump. Also a very hot wash cloth pressed on your boobs for a few minutes helps wonders. When you take hot showers you can always press from the top of your boob until you hit your nipples and that will make them release pressure also. Hope it helps.

Actually, u can start expressing it and freezing it at 32 weeks as long as it doesn't give u pains or anything. And the more you express it the more you'll make, that's why alot people do it, is to increase the milk supply

It actually doesn't increase milk supply, how much milk you produce is based after delivery the supply meets the demand of your baby. Some women do save their colustrum mainly if they know ahead of time their baby might need to be formula fed at first,for instance women with gestational diabetes who's babies may have unstable glucose levels after birth. Though for every bottle of formula fed to baby,you also need to pump so your body keeps producing milk. While it can be used for instances like this, it is still not recommended to pump before birth.

question: I started leakin at 27 weeks im now 32 weeks.im not leakin alot just every now   and then. It just bes little bits it doesn't flow or anything. Is it normal to leak and then stop n start again. And should it be a constant flow? Or is on and off normal.. and i heard of some people pumping off the colostrum. milk . whatever its called before the baby is here .. is that safe ? I heard that any nipple stimulation can cause early labor .. is that true ?
title: leakin? and pumping
